intro: Corydalis foetida var. brevipedunculata, commonly known as the stinking corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred petals and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while the stems are slender and often branched. The species is noted for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is most noticeable when the flowers are in bloom.
